alert.note: Alert for McKinley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 16 at 6:12PM MDT until August 16 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WESTERN MCKINLEY COUNTY... At 612 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms previously produced heavy rain in the warned area. Between one and 1.75 inches of rain fell over the last hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing and will subside within the next hour or two. Emergency management reported flooding along State Route 264 from Mile Markers 1 through 10 with cars stalled on the road. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Western Gallup, Rock Springs, Tse Bonito, Yah-Ta-Hey, Mentmore, Twin Lakes and Gamerco. This includes the following highways... State Route 264 from the Arizona border to Mile Marker 12. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Do not drive your vehicle into areas where water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely.
